modules.description: This module provides a specialized map implementation for string keys with extended operations like merging with custom conflict resolution, list-valued map manipulations, and ordered traversal capabilities. It works with polymorphic ordered maps and sequences of key-value pairs, supporting transformations such as filtered folds, bidirectional iteration, and range-based construction. These features are particularly useful for managing hierarchical data structures and composing complex SCAD script configurations where ordered key-value relationships and precise merge semantics are critical.

This module enables constructing and manipulating 3D/2D geometric models using typed vector operations, boolean combinations (union, difference, intersection), and transformations (affine, scaling, rotation). It operates on dimensional data structures like `V2`, `V3`, polygons, meshes, and paths, supporting advanced modeling techniques such as minkowski sums, hull generation, and extrusion. Typical applications include generating precise CAD models for 3D printing or simulation, with end-to-end type safety ensuring valid OpenSCAD script output.

This module exports SCAD scripts and renders 2D and 3D models into formats like PNG, STL, and SVG, supporting camera configuration, color schemes, and projections. It includes helpers for validating and handling file extensions, and uses a specialized string-keyed map submodule to manage ordered, mergeable configuration data with custom conflict resolution and list-valued operations. The map supports range-based construction, filtered folds, and bidirectional iteration, making it ideal for composing and manipulating complex SCAD model hierarchies. Together, these components enable programmatic generation of high-quality visualizations and manufacturing files from OCaml-defined CAD models.

This module visualizes geometric structures by converting paths and meshes into 3D shapes with indexed styling. It applies a given styling function to each element, allowing distinct visual identification of components like path segments or mesh faces. Use it to debug spatial constructions by generating color-coded or sized representations of 2D paths, 3D paths, or triangular meshes.

This module defines types for text alignment and direction used in 3D text rendering configurations. It includes horizontal and vertical alignment options, as well as text flow directions. These types are used to specify how generated text should be positioned and oriented in 3D space when creating models.

This module defines color values for 3D modeling, supporting both predefined color names and custom colors via RGB or hexadecimal specifications. It allows precise color representation using floating-point RGB values or hex strings with optional alpha channels. Use cases include setting material colors in 3D models, generating visually distinct components, and exporting color data for rendering or visualization tools.

This module suite supports the programmatic construction, manipulation, and visualization of 2D and 3D geometric models with strong type safety. It provides dimensional vectors (`V2`, `V3`), boolean operations, transformations, and advanced modeling techniques like extrusion and minkowski sums, enabling precise CAD model generation. The system exports models to SCAD, STL, SVG, and PNG formats, with styling, coloring, and text rendering capabilities for visualization and debugging. Examples include generating 3D-printable parts with boolean operations, creating color-coded mesh components for inspection, and rendering styled 3D text with alignment control.
